thread.title: Ty Sambrailo sits out Broncos' practice with sore shoulder
thread.title_full: Ty Sambrailo sits out Broncos' practice with sore shoulder - The Denver Post

author: Nicki Jhabvala
title: Ty Sambrailo sits out Broncos' practice with sore shoulder
text:
Ty Sambrailo, the Broncos' rookie left tackle, was the lone absentee from practice Wednesday because of a sore shoulder.
Coach Gary Kubiak said Sambrailo, who was injured in Sunday's game at Detroit, is "day to day," but Kubiak hopes he will return to practice Thursday.
"Even though he's a rookie, I'm not that concerned with the reps," Kubiak said. "We just have to get him healthy."
Juwan Thompson participated fully in practice after injuring his neck Sunday. As did defensive end Kenny Anunike (knee), Omar Bolden (foot) and Kayvon Webster (ankle), who was ruled out of the Lions game.
Peyton Manning walked through drills early, but was listed on the injury report as having taken his non-injury-related day off, per Kubiak's plan for him.
Louis Vasquez also was given veteran's time off, Kubiak said, although he officially was listed on the injury report as not participating because of a lingering knee injury that limited him last week.
Ward gets defensive honors In his second game back from his suspension, safety T.J. Ward made nine combined tackles against the Lions, second on the team and enough to earn Broncos defensive player of the game.
"I'm really proud of T.J.," Kubiak said. "He missed that first week, and when players go through that, I think they get humbled and see how much they really miss what they have. He's come back and played really well."
